NDC01.desc: Current levels of all higher reduction targets for 2030 are further increased by 10%

NDC02.desc: Current levels of all lower reduction targets for 2030 are further decreased by 10%

GMP01.desc: GMP is additional to the near-term reductions targets declared in NDCs

GMP02.desc: All countries continue to reduce CH4 emissions after 2030 to achieve a further 30% reduction by 2100 from 2030 levels

LTS01.desc: Countries currently having no long-term target reach net-zero in 2070

LTS02.desc: Countries currently having a net-zero target after 2050 reach net-zero in 2050

LTS03.desc: Countries with a 2050 net zero target year reach net-zero in 2040

LTS04.desc: Countries currently having a net-zero target delay it by 10 years

LTS05.desc: Countries currently with a net-zero target follow a net-zero GHG

LTS06.desc: Countries currently with a net-zero target follow a net-zero CO2 only

LUF01.desc: Stopping deforestation with reforestation continuing at current levels + 100% control of forest degradation

LUF02.desc: Partial control on current deforestation with reforestation continuing at current levels + 50% control of forest degradation

LUF03.desc: Continued deforestation at current levels but with increasing reforestation + 10% control of forest degradation

N2O++.desc: All countries reduce N2O emissions by 13% (relative to 2022) in 2030 and by 18% (relative to 2022) in 2035

CH4++.desc: Countries without GMP reduce CH4 emissions by 30% (relative to 2022) in 2030 and all countries reduce CH4 emissions by 40% (relative to 2022) in 2035

countries: Macedonia, the former Yugoslav Republic of

intro.main:
Countries around the world will revise their national climate targets by the end of 2025 to be consistent with the 1.5 °C warming target of the Paris Agreement. On the other hand, there are challenges in implementing existing targets to national policies, which could lead to a delay in achieving the targets and possibly a rollback of existing national targets.

On the Decarbonization Observatory, you can explore ways of enhancing and delaying target(s) by selecting pledges globally or for a country. Their impacts on greenhouse gas emissions and global-mean temperatures will be presented in different colors. You can find the descriptions of the pledges by moving the pointer to the question mark beside each pledge.

combined-impact.title: Emission and temperature impacts of enhanced and delayed national pledges
combined-impact.subtitle:
The impacts of enhanced pledges are shown relative to the low reference scenario (lower dashed line) based on the current conditional national targets contingent on external support.
The impacts of delayed pledges are shown relative to the high reference scenario (higher dashed line) based on the current unconditional national targets.
combined-impact.legend-short:
Overview of the enhanced and delayed pledges
  • 2030+: Strengthen the current near-term targets (conditional) by 10%.
  • 2030-: Weaken the current near-term targets (unconditional) by 10%.


CH4+: Implement the Global Methane Pledge (GMP) to the current participating countries (30% CH4 reduction by 2030 relative to 2020)
CH4++: Implement the GMP to all other countries and achieve further 30% CH4 reductions by 2100
CH4++: Implement the GMP to all other countries and achieve further 40% CH4 reductions by 2035 (relative to 2022)
N2O+: Achieve 13% N2O reduction by 2030 and 18% N2O reduction by 2035 (relative to 2022)

Zero2070: Countries currently having no long-term target reach net-zero in 2070.
Zero2050: Countries currently having a net-zero target after 2050 reach net-zero in 2050.
Zero2040: Countries currently having a net-zero target in 2050 reach net-zero in 2040.
Zero-10yrs: Countries currently having a net-zero target delay it by 10 years.
ZeroGHG: Countries currently with a net-zero target follow a net-zero GHG.
ZeroCO2: Countries currently with a net-zero target follow a net-zero CO2 only.

LUF+++: Stop deforestation with reforestation continuing at current levels + 100% control of forest degradation
LUF++: Partially control deforestation with reforestation continuing at current levels + 50% control of forest degradation
LUF+: Continue deforestation at current levels but with increasing reforestation + 10% control of forest degradation

Certain emissions can be reduced by more than one pledge. This means that pledges can overlap each other. This panel shows the combined impact of selected pledges. The overlaps are not explicitly shown in this panel but are taken into account.

This website is part of our simple, transparent framework for developing emission and temperature scenarios by country. The emission and temperature data are publicly available in spreadsheets, with all assumptions explicitly stated. Temperature calculations are based on a simple yet well-established method that can be traced back in the spreadsheet.

Important to note that our scenarios are intended to explore the emission and temperature outcomes of national targets. Future scenarios are thus developed using a minimum set of assumptions, without considering other aspects, such as the long-term changes in populations and global domestic production. Further details can be found here.

Acknowledgments: Horizon Europe Edu4Climate project (N° 101071247), Horizon 2020 EMME-CARE project (N° 856612), and French ANR PRATO project (MOPGA program; ANR-19-MPGA-0008)

individual-impact.title: Individual impact of enhanced or delayed pledges
individual-impact.subtitle: [Placeholder]
individual-impact.legend-short: Certain emissions can be reduced by more than one pledge. This means that pledges can overlap each other. This panel compare pledges on the same basis by explicitly showing the overlaps among pledges.

current-emissions.title: Emissions under current pledges
current-emissions.subtitle: Visualize global and country-level emissions projections under current pledges
current-emissions.legend-short: Global and country-level emissions projections based on country-specific emissions scenarios.
current-emissions.legend-long: Country-specific scenarios of the future evolution of emissions based on national climate pledges. Red dots represent national climate pledges of each country. A simple mathematical function was applied to extend emissions scenarios from the most recent emission level to the 2030 target level, mid-century net-zero target level and beyond.

global-temperature.title: Global temperature under current pledges
global-temperature.subtitle: Visualize global temperature projections under current pledges
global-temperature.legend-short: Global temperature projections based on country-specific emissions scenarios.
global-temperature.legend-long: Country-specific scenarios of the future evolution of emissions based on national climate pledges. Red dots represent national climate pledges of each country. A simple mathematical function was applied to extend emissions scenarios from the most recent emission level to the 2030 target level, mid-century net-zero target level and beyond.
